Pre-Game Insights: Czechia is a rightful favorite in this affair but we're not so sure it will be an easy three points.
The road to the Euro 2024 knockout rounds looks a bit steeper for Georgia and Czechia after opening game losses.

The Czechs had the bigger heartbreak in the first set of Group F fixtures as they fell to a last-gasp Portugal winner on Tuesday, while Georgia faded in a 3-1 loss to Turkey in their European Championships debut.
Khvicha Kvaratskhelia & Co. get the underdogs tag for this June 22 battle in the latest Euro 2024 odds.
It’s easy to understand why Czechia is entering the favorites, particularly after such a disciplined performance on Tuesday.
The Czechs had just 27% of the possession against Portugal, buying into a compact defensive game plan to frustrate Cristiano Ronaldo and Bruno Fernandes.
I have my doubts about whether Czechia have the firepower to go on the offensive, even with Patrik Schick healthy after an injury-hit season.
With the early tournament nerves out of the way, I expect a better effort from Georgia here.
Willy Sagnol’s men are good enough to make this a real contest and it only takes an instant for Khvicha Kvaratskhelia to create a moment of magic.
The quality of Valencia keeper Giorgi Mamardashvili helps their chances of grabbing a point and it took some terrific Turkish strikes to get past him on Tuesday.
Georgia have picked up draws against Scotland and Greece in the past 12 months, and they’re capable of a similarly competitive effort against a solid but unspectacular Czechia team.
If Georgia are going to match their higher-ranked opponents on Saturday, it’s going to require a headline performance from talisman Khvicha Kvaratskhelia.
With some inexperienced defenders at the international level, Czechia haven’t kept a clean sheet in any of their last five games and were outshot 19-5 against Portugal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather: Cloudy, humid conditions, with temperatures in the high 60s.
